channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-11932] Stop the html-single from building a html-single of every chapter and cluttering the docbkx directory
item.summary: Stop the html-single from building a html-single of every chapter and cluttering the docbkx directory

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Silly simple fix.

+1

Didn't try it.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12667586/HBASE-11932.patch
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12667586

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+0 tests included. The patch appears to be a documentation patch that doesn't require tests.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:

-1 core zombie tests. There are 2 zombie test(s): at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ResourceCheckerJUnitListener.testFinished(ResourceCheckerJUnitListener.java:184)
at org.apache.activemq.broker.region.QueuePurgeTest.testPurgeLargeQueueWithConsumer(QueuePurgeTest.java:128)

This issue is not in the master branch, right Misty Stanley-Jones ? I tried apply and it fails.
Not sure what I did wrong. Trying again.
I tried on current master. Normal apply failed, but git apply -p0 ../patches/HBASE-11932.patch worked.

This message is automatically generated.

My fault. I was trying to apply to the wrong branch.

Testing, I have this in the docbkx directory now which seems like an improvement:

kalashnikov:docbkx stack$ ls -la
total 3360
drwxr-xr-x 17 stack staff 578 Sep 10 14:47 .
drwxr-xr-x 4 stack staff 136 Sep 10 14:47 ..
drwxr-xr-x 228 stack staff 7752 Sep 10 14:47 book
rw-rr- 1 stack staff 1586207 Sep 10 14:47 book.html
drwxr-xr-x 4 stack staff 136 Sep 10 14:47 css
rw-rr- 1 stack staff 88080 Sep 10 14:47 hbase-default.xml
drwxr-xr-x 26 stack staff 884 Sep 10 14:47 images
rw-rr- 1 stack staff 613 Sep 10 14:47 java.html
rw-rr- 1 stack staff 571 Sep 10 14:47 ld-d0e14048.html
rw-rr- 1 stack staff 432 Sep 10 14:47 ld-d0e18269.html
rw-rr- 1 stack staff 440 Sep 10 14:47 ld-d0e18278.html
rw-rr- 1 stack staff 454 Sep 10 14:47 ld-d0e18287.html
rw-rr- 1 stack staff 447 Sep 10 14:47 ld-d0e18296.html
rw-rr- 1 stack staff 500 Sep 10 14:47 ld-d0e18339.html
rw-rr- 1 stack staff 402 Sep 10 14:47 ld-d0e23028.html
rw-rr- 1 stack staff 402 Sep 10 14:47 ld-d0e23038.html
rw-rr- 1 stack staff 402 Sep 10 14:47 ld-d0e23053.html

Anything to be done about the ld-*.html stuff?

+1

Scope increased to clear out some extra files that were generated due to Docbook choices that were made historically.

  • Removed all footnotes and rewrote as necessary.
  • Changed <textobject> inside <figure> (which generates alt text on images) to <caption>.

Also corrected mention of docbook.com to docbook.org in the preface, even though out of scope for here.
Go for it. +1
Committed to master and branch-1 (had to skip the src/main/docbkx/appendix_hfile_format.xml patch for branch-1).

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12667885/HBASE-11932-v2.patch
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12667885

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+0 tests included. The patch appears to be a documentation patch that doesn't require tests.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 lineLengths. The patch introduces the following lines longer than 100:
+ xlink:href="http://www.larsgeorge.com/2009/10/hbase-architecture-101-storage.html"
+ xlink:href="http://terracotta.org/documentation/4.0/bigmemorygo/configuration/storage-options"
+ <listitem><para>Subsequent replicas are written on random nodes on the cluster. See <emphasis>Replica Placement: The First Baby Steps</emphasis> on this page: <link
+ xlink:href="http://hadoop.apache.org/docs/stable/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-hdfs/HdfsDesign.html"
+ xlink:href="http://www.cloudera.com/blog/2009/03/configuration-parameters-what-can-you-just-ignore/"
+ <screen language="bourne">$ mvn clean install assembly:single -Dhadoop.profile=2.0 -DskipTests</screen></entry>
+ the cluster. The pseudo-distributed vs fully-distributed nomenclature comes from Hadoop.</para>
+ bloomfilters</link>. For description of the development process – why static blooms rather than dynamic
+ xlink:href="https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HBASE-1200">HBase-1200</link>. The bloom filters described here are actually version two of blooms in HBase. In
+ <programlisting><MAGIC 4 byte integer> <1 byte RPC Format Version> <1 byte auth type></programlisting>

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:

at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.TestCellCounter.testCellCounter(TestCellCounter.java:96)

Stack is the one who told me to put 0.99.1. Can you explain it to me, Enis Soztutar?

Stack is the one who told me to put 0.99.1. Can you explain it to me

No worries. I was in the process of "cutting" the release candidate for 0.99.0 yesterday, but it got blocked due to some reason. I am now cutting another candidate for 0.99.0 which will include this patch, that is why I changed the fixVersion back to 0.99.0. The release manager (in this case myself) is responsible for these, so you do not have to worry there. It would be sufficient to set the fixVersion to the first unreleased version from the branch on regular cases. For example, in this case, all jiras committed to 0.99 branch will have 0.99.1 until a release candidate is cut. After that, all jiras will be marked with 0.99.2, etc.
Got it. I want to do the right thing and not cause any extra work for anyone.
Please try it, stack or someone...
Oops attached to wrong case. Sorry.
Misty Stanley-Jones now the "Hadoop version support matrix" contains a giant cell containing all the text. It is not readable I think. Should we have kept it as a footnote?
Thanks for catching that.

SUCCESS: Integrated in HBase-1.0 #174 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-1.0/174/)
HBASE-11932 Docbook html-single build improvements (Addendum to fix XML formatting) (enis: rev a1b956eb30854f4927af3db4bbbf92eebd75987e)

Closing this issue after 0.99.0 release.
